ygData.subject: Another Nerf (but we can't complain about this one!)
ygData.msgSnippet: Even more evidence that Verant doesn t practice quality assurance when it comes to testing.  You would think that this is something that would have gotten
ygData.messageBody:
Even more evidence that Verant doesn't practice quality assurance when it
comes to testing. You would think that this is something that would have
gotten easily caught had they checked it. I mean the whole purpose of
adding the song was to raise the level cap for charm. After testing it
against a level 38+ mob to see if it worked, the next mob I would have
tested it against is one I knew it wasn't supposed to work on (hmmm perhaps
a god would be a good choice).

Galtin

-----Original Message-----
From: Daniel P. Sniderman [mailto:fuzzbone@...]
Sent: Monday, April 17, 2000 1:39 PM
To: EQ Bards
Subject: [eqbards] Another Nerf (but we can't complain about this one!)


Hot off the www.eqvault.com presses: I guess we can't complain as long as
it's a REASONABLE Cap!


Today's patch primarily contained preparations for Kunark, including some
new art. There was also a bug that was fixed with a bard song that was put
in last Tuesday. The song (a charm upgrade) was not capped. Someone was kind
enough to send us a screenshot of someone with a *really nice* pet named
Cazic-Thule.

-Gordon

Slyde Katzenjammer

39th Level Bard of Xegony
